definitions.text:
Let \(S\) be the successor function. \(\mathbb N\) is defined as follows:
  • \(0 \in \mathbb N\)
  • \(\forall n \in \mathbb N . succ(n) \in \mathbb N\).
definitions.coq:
Inductive nat : Type := | zero : nat | succ : nat -> nat.
Notation "0" := (zero).

definitions.text:
Let \( ({+}) : \mathbb N \times \mathbb N \to \mathbb N \) be defined as follows:
  • \(0 + m \triangleq m\)
  • \( succ (n) + m \triangleq succ (n + m) \).
definitions.coq:
Fixpoint add (n m : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => m | succ n' => succ (add n' m) end.
Notation "A + B" := (add A B).

theorems.name: add_dist
theorems.text: Addition is distributive: \[ \forall a, b, c \in \mathbb N . (a + b) + c = a + (b + c) \]
theorems.coq:
Theorem add_dist : forall a b c : nat, add (add a b) c = add a (add b c).
Proof.
Admitted.

theorems.name: add_zero_left
theorems.text: 0 is the left identity for +:\[ \forall a \in \mathbb N . 0 + a = a \]
theorems.coq:
Theorem add_zero_left : forall a : nat, add 0 a = a.
Proof.
Admitted.

theorems.name: add_zero_right
theorems.text: 0 is the right identity for +:\[ \forall a \in \mathbb N . a + 0 = a \]
theorems.coq:
Theorem add_zero_right : forall a : nat, add a 0 = a.
Proof.
Admitted.

tactics.name: intro
tactics.text: Introduce a variable:\[ P \to Q \text{ becomes ``given $P$ prove $Q$''} \]\[ \forall x : A , P \text{ becomes ``given $x : A$ prove $P$''} \]
